byline.contributor: Jack Ewing reported from Cologne and Montabaur, Germany; and Melissa Eddy from Düsseldorf, Germany. Reporting was contributed by Alison Smale from Berlin; Nicola Clark from Paris; Katrin Bennhold from London; and Richard Pérez-Peña, Christopher Drew and Jad Mouawad from New York.
byline.original: By JACK EWING and MELISSA EDDY

abstract: Profile of Andreas Lubitz, German co-pilot who French officials say deliberately caused crash of Germanwings Flight 9525, killing himself and 149 other people; records indicate Lubitz had passed all medical and flying tests, and reveal few signs that he had become troubled or disturbed; associates describe him as cheerful and professionally careful.
lead_paragraph: The co-pilot accused of deliberately crashing a plane into the Alps passed all medical and flying tests, Lufthansa officials said.

headline.main: Andreas Lubitz, Who Loved to Fly, Ended Up on a Mysterious and Deadly Course
headline.print_headline: A Man Who Loved to Fly, Set on a Mysterious and Deadly Course

snippet: The co-pilot accused of deliberately crashing a plane into the Alps passed all medical and flying tests, Lufthansa officials said.
